newsitem.title: USA: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.
newsitem.headline: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.

text.p: Assets of the nation's 667 retail money market mutual funds rose $2.70 billion to $590.48 billion in the week ended Aug. 21, the Investment Company Institute, an industry trade group, said Thursday.
It said assets of the 409 taxable money market funds in the retail category rose $1.86 billion to $480.77 billion, while assets of the 258 tax-exempt funds rose $837.3 million to $109.71 billion.

The trade group said assets of the 304 institutional money market funds rose $7.84 billion to $270.91 billion. Of these, the 243 taxable money market fund assets rose $7.06 billion to $241.77 billion, and assets of the 61 tax exempt funds rose $782.9 million to $29.15 billion.
Money market mutual fund assets stood at $861.39 billion in the week. Assets for the week ended Aug 14 were revised to $850.86 billion from $851.39 billion.
